alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:27AM EST until December 20 at 2:24AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. Penobscot River At Eddington affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Penobscot River at Grindstone. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, State Route 11 flooded in places. Homes and camps threatened. Significant flooding of Penobscot River Trails. Moderate backwater flooding of Mud & Hay Brooks. At 15.0 feet, State Route 11 flooded and impassable. Homes and camps inundated. Logging roads west and near the river will be flooded. Hathaway Road flooded near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 14.4 feet. - River is out of its banks. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 8.6 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.3 feet on 09/29/1909. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 700 PM EST.
